dict.acceptation: （使）惊恐( frighten的过去式和过去分词)；吓唬；

sent.orig: The frightened bird resumes his song asas danger and so does the frightened rabbit his games.
sent.trans: 受惊的鸟儿一旦危险解除就会重新歌唱，恐惧过后的兔子也会重新游戏。

sent.orig: I can't understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I'm frightened of the old ones.
sent.trans: 我不能理解人们为什么要为新鲜的观点感到恐惧。我恐惧旧的。

sent.orig: For a truth, she was rather shocked and frightened by this evidence of human depravity.
sent.trans: 说实话，这事足以证明人类的邪恶。这证据让她大为震惊和害怕。

sent.orig: But young Putin is also an ordinary boy, frightened by a looming visit to the dentist.
sent.trans: 但年轻的普京也是一个普通的男孩，也害怕去看牙医。
